entries.name: port
entries.desc: The port on this target host of this service. The range is 0-65535.

entries.name: priority
entries.desc: The priority of this target host. A client MUST attempt to contact the target host with the lowest-numbered priority it can reach; target hosts with the same priority SHOULD be tried in an order defined by the weight field. The range is 0-65535.  Note that it is not widely implemented and should be set to zero.

entries.name: target
entries.desc: The domain name of the target host. A target of “.” means that the service is decidedly not available at this domain.

entries.name: weight
entries.desc: A server selection mechanism. The weight field specifies a relative weight for entries with the same priority. Larger weights SHOULD be given a proportionately higher probability of being selected. The range of this number is 0-65535.  Domain administrators SHOULD use Weight 0 when there isn't any server selection to do, to make the RR easier to read for humans (less noisy). Note that it is not widely implemented and should be set to zero.
